entries.name: comment
entries.desc: Our comment

entries.name: document_children
entries.desc: Do we document our children?

entries.name: document_self
entries.desc: Do we document ourselves?

entries.name: done_documenting
entries.desc: Are we done documenting (ie, did we come across a :enddoc:)?

entries.name: file
entries.desc: Which file this code object was defined in

entries.name: force_documentation
entries.desc: Force documentation of this CodeObject

entries.name: line
entries.desc: Line in file where this CodeObject was defined

entries.name: metadata
entries.desc: Hash of arbitrary metadata for this CodeObject

entries.name: parent
entries.desc: Sets the parent CodeObject

entries.name: received_nodoc
entries.desc: Did we ever receive a :nodoc: directive?

entries.name: section
entries.desc: Set the section this CodeObject is in

entries.name: store
entries.desc: The RDoc::Store for this object.

entries.name: viewer
entries.desc: We are the model of the code, but we know that at some point we will be worked on by viewers. By implementing the Viewable protocol, viewers can associated themselves with these objects.

entries.name: new()
entries.desc: Creates a new CodeObject that will document itself and its children

entries.name: comment=(comment)
entries.desc: Replaces our comment with comment, unless it is empty.

entries.name: display?()
entries.desc: Should this CodeObject be displayed in output?

entries.name: document_children=(document_children)
entries.desc: Enables or disables documentation of this CodeObject's children unless it has been turned off by :enddoc:

entries.name: document_self=(document_self)
entries.desc: Enables or disables documentation of this CodeObject unless it has been turned off by :enddoc:.  If the argument is nil it means the documentation is turned off by :nodoc:.

entries.name: documented?()
entries.desc: Does this object have a comment with content or is received_nodoc true?

entries.name: done_documenting=(value)
entries.desc: Turns documentation on/off, and turns on/off document_self and document_children.

entries.name: each_parent()
entries.desc: Yields each parent of this CodeObject.  See also RDoc::ClassModule#each_ancestor

entries.name: file_name()
entries.desc: File name where this CodeObject was found.

entries.name: force_documentation=(value)
entries.desc: Force the documentation of this object unless documentation has been turned off by :enddoc:

entries.name: full_name=(full_name)
entries.desc: Sets the full_name overriding any computed full name.

entries.name: ignore()
entries.desc: Use this to ignore a CodeObject and all its children until found again (#record_location is called).  An ignored item will not be displayed in documentation.

entries.name: ignored?()
entries.desc: Has this class been ignored?

entries.name: options()
entries.desc: The options instance from the store this CodeObject is attached to, or a default options instance if the CodeObject is not attached.

entries.name: parent()
entries.desc: Our parent CodeObject.  The parent may be missing for classes loaded from legacy RI data stores.

entries.name: parent_file_name()
entries.desc: File name of our parent

entries.name: parent_name()
entries.desc: Name of our parent

entries.name: record_location(top_level)
entries.desc: Records the RDoc::TopLevel (file) where this code object was defined

entries.name: section()
entries.desc: The section this CodeObject is in.  Sections allow grouping of constants, attributes and methods inside a class or module.

entries.name: start_doc()
entries.desc: Enable capture of documentation unless documentation has been turned off by :enddoc:

entries.name: stop_doc()
entries.desc: Disable capture of documentation

entries.name: store=(store)
entries.desc: Sets the store that contains this CodeObject

entries.name: suppress()
entries.desc: Use this to suppress a CodeObject and all its children until the next file it is seen in or documentation is discovered.  A suppressed item with documentation will be displayed while an ignored item with documentation may not be displayed.

entries.name: suppressed?()
entries.desc: Has this class been suppressed?
